current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was considered and agreed to

text.#text: encourages all people of the United States to become more informed and aware of cerebral palsy; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to transmit a copy of this resolution to Reaching
			 for the Stars: A Foundation of Hope for Children with Cerebral Palsy.

text.#text:
Whereas the majority of children who have cerebral palsy are born with the disorder, although
			 cerebral palsy may remain undetected for months or years;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

text.#text: Whereas approximately 800,000 people in the United States are affected by cerebral palsy;

Whereas although there is currently no cure for cerebral palsy, treatment often improves the
			 capabilities of a child with cerebral palsy;

Whereas scientists and researchers are hopeful that breakthroughs in cerebral palsy research will
			 be forthcoming;

Whereas researchers across the United States are conducting important research projects involving
			 cerebral palsy; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is an institution that can raise awareness in the general public and the medical
			 community about cerebral palsy: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SRES 396 ATS: Designating March 25, 2014, as “National Cerebral Palsy Awareness Day”.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
